Text: Good stuff! This is the kinda software that makes pc-gaming memorable.
very nice

All Lucasarts games work on XP with ScummVM.
With the other games you have to try different configurations and compatibility modes. I cannot guarantee that all games works on XP.
If they dont work on XP, try running them with DosBox or Virtual PC.

hej! en fråga, eftersom du har polis quest 1 så undrar jag om du har de andra Sierra spelen. finns ju inga bättre spel änn Sony Bond o killarna. om du inte har det, vet du vart man kan få tag på dem? MVH

schlanan: Hero Quest och Kings Quest är alla Sierraspel.
Vilka spel syftar du på?

Hm... Hero's Quest är Sierra, men bör räknas som en outsider i den serien som han nog syftar på, som innefattar King's Quest 1-8, Space Quest 1-6, Larry 1-7 och Police Quest 1-4. Space Quest 2, King's Quest 5 och Police Quest 1 hör till mina favoritspel alla kategorier. Jag har ett antal av dem, jag kanske skapar en torrent i en avlägsen framtid.
Cheers mate. Memories

If you need just a couple of these games, try using BitComet. Versions 0.60 & 0.61 of it allow you to download single files from any torrent (likely, other versions can do this too, but I haven't checked). For example, you don't have to download all the 10GB of Half-Life Gigapack if you just need Opposing Force :)

Be careful, downloaders, some of these games don't work correctly on newer computers. What Lausten is asking for is a good example. I run XP Home, SP2 with all the updates and Warcraft 2 has no sound of any kind, some of the control functions don't work, you cannot scale down the image sizes, and the mouse scrolling (moving your view over the battlefield) is insanely fast. All of my hardware is pre-Windows XP, so that isn't whats doing it.
